newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela to pay $908 mln debt by year end -Matos.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela to pay $908 mln debt by year end -Matos.

text.p: Venezuela has 427 billion bolivars ($908 million) of pending debts that have to be settled before the end of the year under an agreement with the IMF, Finance Minister Luis Raul Matos Azocar said.

Over 122 billion bolivars ($259 million) of that total are payments on foreign debt, backed by the Republic, for the Caracas subway system and state-owned electricity distribution company Cadafe, Matos told the influential congressional finance committee.
Matos said the Finance ministry would seeking congressional approval for three credits totalling 447 billion bolivars ($951 million), most of which would be used to settle the debt payments.
